com.yworks.yfiles.layout

Class HideGroupsStage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.AbstractLayoutStage
      • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.HideGroupsStage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILayoutAlgorithm, ILayoutStage

    public class HideGroupsStage
extends AbstractLayoutStage
    A layout stage that hides the group nodes of hierarchically grouped graphs.

    This stage removes all group nodes and adjacent edges from the graph before passing it to the core layout algorithm. After the core layout algorithm has arranged the graph, the hidden elements will be reinserted.

    This stage is used by layout algorithms that cannot handle grouped graphs (e.g. CircularLayout).

    • Method Detail

      • applyLayout

        public void applyLayout(LayoutGraph graph)
        Calculates the layout based on the given core layout algorithm.

        Before calling the core layout algorithm, group nodes and their adjacent edges will be hidden. After the layout has been calculated, HideGroupsStage will restore the graph.

        Specified by:
        applyLayout in interface ILayoutAlgorithm
        Specified by:
        applyLayout in class AbstractLayoutStage
         
        The given graph will not be copied during the layout process and the layout will be immediately applied to the given graph.
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph

      • getGroupBoundsCalculator

        public IGroupBoundsCalculator getGroupBoundsCalculator()
        Gets the IGroupBoundsCalculator instance for calculating the sizes of group nodes.

        For every group which is in its open state, the IGroupBoundsCalculator will be asked to calculate the bounds for the group's child nodes. The resulting size will be used during the ongoing layout calculation.

        Returns:
        the IGroupBoundsCalculator instance
        See Also:
        setGroupBoundsCalculator(IGroupBoundsCalculator)

      • hideGroupNodes

        public void hideGroupNodes(LayoutGraph graph)
        Hides the group nodes and their incident edges of the input graph.

        Furthermore, this method removes all grouping-related IDataProviders from the input graph.

        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph
        See Also:
        GroupingKeys.NODE_ID_DPKEY, GroupingKeys.PARENT_NODE_ID_DPKEY, GroupingKeys.GROUP_DPKEY, unhideGroupNodes(LayoutGraph)

      • isEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled

        public boolean isEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled()
        Gets whether or not empty group nodes, i.e., group nodes without children, will be hidden by this stage.
        Default Value:
        The default value is true. All group nodes will be hidden.
        Returns:
        true if all group nodes will be hidden, false if only group nodes with children will be hidden
        See Also:
        setEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled(boolean)

      • setEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled

        public void setEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether or not empty group nodes, i.e., group nodes without children, will be hidden by this stage.
        Default Value:
        The default value is true. All group nodes will be hidden.
        Parameters:
        value - true if all group nodes will be hidden, false if only group nodes with children will be hidden
        See Also:
        isEmptyGroupNodeHidingEnabled()

      • setGroupBoundsCalculator

        public void setGroupBoundsCalculator(IGroupBoundsCalculator value)
        Sets the IGroupBoundsCalculator instance for calculating the sizes of group nodes.

        For every group which is in its open state, the IGroupBoundsCalculator will be asked to calculate the bounds for the group's child nodes. The resulting size will be used during the ongoing layout calculation.

        Parameters:
        value - the IGroupBoundsCalculator instance
        See Also:
        getGroupBoundsCalculator()

      • unhideGroupNodes

        public void unhideGroupNodes(LayoutGraph graph)
        Un-hides the group nodes and their incident edges of the input graph that were previously hidden using method hideGroupNodes(LayoutGraph).

        Furthermore, this method restores all previously removed grouping related IDataProviders on the input graph.

        Parameters:
        graph - the given graph
        See Also:
        GroupingKeys.NODE_ID_DPKEY, GroupingKeys.PARENT_NODE_ID_DPKEY, GroupingKeys.GROUP_DPKEY, hideGroupNodes(LayoutGraph)
